author: Special Correspondent
text:
A CRPF jawan was killed and four others were injured in an improvised explosive device (IED) blast triggered by Maoists on the Chhattisgarh-Telangana border on Friday.

“An IED blast occurred at around 10 a.m. today near Muraliguda village on Chhattisgarh-Telangana border. Our parties had gone around 2 km west from Maraliguda to provide protection for road construction works. Head constable Ranga Raghvan was killed in the blast,” the CRPF said.
title: CRPF jawan killed in IED blast
